title: [BUG] AttributeError: 'Index' object has no attribute '_ndarray_values'
body:
Dear all,

I am new to sktime. When I followed the forecasting part of the tutorial and ran this code line: from sktime.utils.plotting import plot_series, I got this error: AttributeError: 'Index' object has no attribute '_ndarray_values'. The detailed traceback were:


  File "<ipython-input-15-c9c95ff1127e>", line 1, in <module>
    from sktime.utils.plotting import plot_series

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\sktime\utils\plotting.py", line 20, in <module>
    from sktime.datatypes import convert_to

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\sktime\datatypes\__init__.py", line 6, in <module>
    from sktime.datatypes._check import check_is, check_raise, mtype

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\sktime\datatypes\_check.py", line 31, in <module>
    from sktime.datatypes._panel import check_dict_Panel

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\sktime\datatypes\_panel\__init__.py", line 7, in <module>
    from sktime.datatypes._panel._examples import example_dict as example_dict_Panel

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\sktime\datatypes\_panel\_examples.py", line 60, in <module>
    X = X.set_index(["instances", "timepoints"])

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 4295, in set_index

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\base.py", line 3902, in __contains__
    left_lev_indexer = ensure_int64(left_lev_indexer)

  File "pandas\_libs\properties.pyx", line 34, in pandas._libs.properties.CachedProperty.__get__

  File "D:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\indexes\base.py", line 608, in _engine
    The array interface, return my values.

AttributeError: 'Index' object has no attribute '_ndarray_values'

I have no idea how that error happened. Could anyone kindly help me? Thanks a lot!
